alert.note: Alert for Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 2:55PM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... Oconaluftee River At Birdtown affecting Swain County. .Heavy rain has ended across Swain County and the lower Tuckasegee River watershed. Storm-total rainfall of 3-5 inches occurred, causing significant rises on both the Oconaluftee and Tuckasegee Rivers from Cherokee to Birdtown to Bryson City. This will cause nuisance to Minor flooding along the lower Oconaluftee and Tuckasgee rivers, with impacts to low-lying elevations near Birdtown and US 19. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Oconaluftee River at Birdtown. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water may approach the water treatment plant on Old Highway Number 4. Water will approach residential yards on Highway 19 between Adams Creek and McCoy Branch Rd. At 10.0 feet, Parts of Old Highway 4 near Keener Road may be flooded and floodwaters may be approaching buildings near Cline and Haiger Streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.8 feet and rising rapidly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action/Advisory Stage is 8.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 700 AM EST.
